prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in philosophy would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in philosophy would. Find the reflection of $\begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}$ over the vector $\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}.$
gpt_response:
To find the reflection of a vector $\begin{pmatrix} a \\ b \end{pmatrix}$ over a vector $\begin{pmatrix} c \\ d \end{pmatrix},$ we can use the formula

\[
\begin{pmatrix} a \\ b \end{pmatrix}_{\text{refl}} = 2 \cdot \frac{\begin{pmatrix} a \\ b \end{pmatrix} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} c \\ d \end{pmatrix}}{\|\begin{pmatrix} c \\ d \end{pmatrix}\|^2} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} c \\ d \end{pmatrix} - \begin{pmatrix} a \\ b \end{pmatrix}.
\]In this case, our vector is $\begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}$ and our vector to reflect over is $\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}.$ 

Calculating, we have

\begin{align*}
\begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} &= (-2)(2) + (3)(1) = -4 + 3 = -1, \\
\|\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}\|^2 &= \left\| \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} \right\|^2 = (2^2 + 1^2) = 5,
\end{align*}so our reflected vector is

\begin{align*}
\begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}_{\text{refl}} &= 2 \cdot \frac{-1}{5} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} - \begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} \\
&= \frac{-2}{5} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} - \begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} \\
&= \begin{pmatrix} -4/5 \\ -2/5 \end{pmatrix} - \begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} \\
&= \boxed{\begin{pmatrix} -6/5 \\ -17/5 \end{pmatrix}}.
\end{align*}
solution_prompt:
The following is a response to a question. Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following response \begin{pmatrix} 6/5 \\ -17/5 \end{pmatrix}?: To find the reflection of a vector $\begin{pmatrix} a \\ b \end{pmatrix}$ over a vector $\begin{pmatrix} c \\ d \end{pmatrix},$ we can use the formula

\[
\begin{pmatrix} a \\ b \end{pmatrix}_{\text{refl}} = 2 \cdot \frac{\begin{pmatrix} a \\ b \end{pmatrix} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} c \\ d \end{pmatrix}}{\|\begin{pmatrix} c \\ d \end{pmatrix}\|^2} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} c \\ d \end{pmatrix} - \begin{pmatrix} a \\ b \end{pmatrix}.
\]In this case, our vector is $\begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}$ and our vector to reflect over is $\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}.$ 

Calculating, we have

\begin{align*}
\begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} &= (-2)(2) + (3)(1) = -4 + 3 = -1, \\
\|\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}\|^2 &= \left\| \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} \right\|^2 = (2^2 + 1^2) = 5,
\end{align*}so our reflected vector is

\begin{align*}
\begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}_{\text{refl}} &= 2 \cdot \frac{-1}{5} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} - \begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} \\
&= \frac{-2}{5} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} - \begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} \\
&= \begin{pmatrix} -4/5 \\ -2/5 \end{pmatrix} - \begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} \\
&= \boxed{\begin{pmatrix} -6/5 \\ -17/5 \end{pmatrix}}.
\end{align*}
gpt_response_correct_incorrect: No. The final solution obtained is $\begin{pmatrix} -6/5 \\ -17/5 \end{pmatrix}.$
